pros: Meaningful place to work, Great people, Exciting dynamic work environment.
cons: Client base expansion makes it challenging sometimes to keep up with requirements

review_title: Making a difference in the lives of people with diabetes
years_at_company: Making a difference in the lives of people with diabetes
pros: When you listen to the calls that our Certified Diabetes Educators make to patients struggling with their diabetes, it truly demonstrates our value and purpose.
cons: Like every company, there is the need to prioritize process improvements and technology enhancements.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep growing and moving the company forward

review_title: Honest review from a human perspective, not a disgruntled ex-employee
years_at_company: Honest review from a human perspective, not a disgruntled ex-employee
pros: Great mission/concept and always needed in the never-ending health dilemma that is diabetes. CDEs are worth their weight in gold and will continue to be needed in excess as the diabetes health crisis continues along with the explosion of technology used to treat diabetes, Type 1 and Type 2.
cons:
If you are even considering for one second putting your career, family and health on the line for this disorganized "start-up" that is going down faster than anyone wants to admit, then please stop reading this and move on to the next job opportunity. This company is the biggest contradiction to the Core Values it claims to live by than anything in the business world I have ever seen. Their incompetent lack of efficiencies and respect is quite frankly disgusting. The inefficient and hostile work environment includes being under a microscope 24 hours a day 7 days a week. It never ends and it will never be good-enough. There is no trust, and no adoption of new ideas. Be prepared to be on video calls ALL DAY long and into the evening. You must be an extremely amiable and agreeable individual with no bright ideas to be welcomed here. There is not an ounce of work-life balance, whether you have a child or a sick relative or get diagnosed with a life-threatening illness, it can't get any colder at this place. For a company that prides itself on caring about the physical and mental health of it's patients, it will run your own health right into the ground.
It is just really too bad that the leadership is full of unequipped egos that are constantly stepping on each other that this organization will never get their act together, and they've about run out of time.
Please note that this review is not from a "disgruntled" ex-employee... which is what they will tell you (also, make note of the generic nature of the positive reviews here) this is from a human who would honestly feel terrible for anyone else to go through what dozens of us have that have been let go in the last year!
advice_to_mgmt: Advice to the Board of Directors: Wake-up

pros: Nice people, excellent benefits, great mission.
cons: This is a young company. If you are not keen to building out your own systems or processes, then this would not be the place for you. On the other hand, if you don't mind starting at the beginning, and building your own infrastructure, you will have landed in the right place.

pros: Great hard working colleagues. Great and important mission.
cons: The CEO micromanages everyone in the company. It’s is not only annoying, it is also inefficient and ineffective. Check the turnover rates of employees and you have proof of this problem. Ask anyone in the company (in confidence) what they think of the CEO’s management style, and you will learn the truth of the dysfunctional nature of the company. Changing the company name won’t change the way the company works.
advice_to_mgmt: Since the CEO can’t be replaced, please get some outside help. This company has a lot of potential, but the CEO needs outside coaching of the company will fail.

review_title: Logistical problems with technology wasted a lot of time otherwise, I enjoyed the job
years_at_company: Logistical problems with technology wasted a lot of time otherwise, I enjoyed the job
pros: Phenomenal qualified managers and Supportive employees are part of this company. There was definitely a team spirit although we all worked remotely and I enjoyed the talking heads meetings we had weekly.
cons: Technology difficulties made the job frustrating when I blocked off my work hours and spent 1.5 hours logging in or reporting a problem to IT almost every day. There were no problems with any employees or managers. They were all professional and all worked their tails off. I couldn't continue to barely make any money because of system problems.
advice_to_mgmt: Thoroughly test new computer systems before making employees use them. I have a feeling this has improved in recent months, however. Be sure that the Spanish-speaking and English-speaking lists are divided before handing them to the English-speaking CDEs. It shouldn't be a requirement to filter out non-English speakers when the CDE is paid to onboard and educate clients. This is a waste of time for the employee and makes it too difficult to reach their goals. The mission of the company is excellent. The staff is excellent. The CEO is passionate and positive and an inspiration. The frustration with technology lasted far too long.

pros:

personally and you become involved in some exciting projects along the way.

review_title: Patient first mentality driving wonderful technological solutions
years_at_company: Patient first mentality driving wonderful technological solutions
pros:
-Welcoming and thriving environment with team members dedicated to finding solutions to ensure that patients get the coaching they need

-Incredible drive, positivity, and internal cooperation as being a central point of the culture that is no doubt ensuring ongoing success

-Mentors are more than willing to spend the time to pass on their understandings to ensure continued development of current and future projects

-Everyone has a can-do attitude most importantly
cons: -Can't see any issues! Mostly everyone is focused. No drama.

pros:
CDEs and support staff genuinely care about improving the lives of patients with diabetes.
CEO has created a decent structure/framework for a company aligned with the overall mission
cons:
Very deceptive tactics (i.e. forcing employees to write positive reviews)
Lack of transparency with clients regarding actual data
Unethical treatment of employment contracts/bonuses
Poor employee retention - employees (FTEs in home office) get burnt out with having to deal with the CEO on a daily basis
advice_to_mgmt:
You have a great business model/mission, and genuinely believe in patient care within diabetes. Find a way to focus on this - create a better culture amongst your employees so that they are motivated to work hard vs. forcing them to. This leads to resentment and sub-par efficiencies.

Treat your employees well and you will thrive. Treat them poorly and they will leave.

review_title: Positive team culture, flexible and fun work model
years_at_company: Positive team culture, flexible and fun work model
pros:
Remote work model and ability to self-schedule very convenient and low stress.
Team members are supportive and always willing to share advice; respect for the profession and clients is notable part of the corporate culture.
cons: Access to resources (not really too bad, but a work in progress)

pros: I have been with Fit4D 16 months and have been so happy to have made the transition from a hospital based Diabetes Educator to this unique position within Fit4D. The important aspect for me is that I still have my patient contact and am continuing in a diabetes educator role. We have evolved and are continuing to grow at a rapid pace. Our staff and management are phenomenal very forward thinking and very positive. I have always felt that I could go to my manager with any issue and I would find support. I work from home and love the flexibility of this and no travel time. So would I recommend Fit4D to anyone considering our company? Definitely!
cons: I would not call this a con, but I would let prospective employees that since we are continuing to grow you need to be be aware that your job role will also grow will I think as a great positive. So you do have to be flexible and embrace change.

pros: I am a RN, CDE who has worked at Fit4d less than 6 months, but love the company culture and what we do for our patients everyday. I provide diabetes heath coaching to patients from my home via telephone. We have the opportunity to touch so many peoples' lives in a very unique way. Our CEO is a very forward thinking, kind hearted individual that I recently had the opportunity to meet in person. He genuinely cares for the patients and employees. The Clinical Managers are all very knowledgsble and supportive; they are extremely dedicated and always available via text or email. The entire team is really there to motivate you in positive ways everyday.
cons: You need to be self motivated and well organized for this job!

review_title: A great place to work with a strong culture
years_at_company: A great place to work with a strong culture
pros:
1. Very strong company culture based around its core values, which are discussed every day and the basis on which all feedback is provided. Stories highlighting the core values are shared in all meetings.
2. Strong team of people all motivated around company mission to improve the lives of people living with diabetes and chronic conditions. It's a mission-driven organization and amazing group of people both in … 

Show More
cons:
1. Everyone wears multiple hats and the team is asked to get a lot done, so you need to be able to manage your time effectively and prioritize to do well in this environment
2. Clinical teams all work remotely, so you must be comfortable in environment where you can work with people via phone/video conference. That said, company uses technology very well to make distributed workforce model work very well. But you have to be comfortable with this aspect of the work environment
